content: by holly lively a lively little toad s rainbow stripe sweater overview pattern is written in us terms for this pattern you will be using a 5mm hook & only 2 strands of thread or embroidery floss this sweater is designed to fit a lively little toad created using a 5mm hook & 6-strand embroidery floss materials 5 mm crochet hook 2 strands of embroidery floss or thread 6 colors 2 stripes of each 6 yards ~5 5 meters for customization purposes 3 yards of thread ~2 75 meters per stripe 12 stripes total arms are included in this count note you will only be using 2 of the 6 strands at a time so one skein of each color may be enough for your project depending on the brand of embroidery floss you use stitches/terms used chain double_crochet dctog 2dc between posts very simple exactly how it sounds photos of this are also included colors used color 1 red color 2 orange color 3 yellow color 4 green color 5 blue color 6 purple important notes i highly recommend tying secure knots and sewing/weaving in the ends as you go after every color change if you re using more than 2 colors after row 2 you may begin your row in any gap you prefer when making the body and arm portions colors are assigned a number so that the pattern is customizable if you choose to reorder/reassign colors i recommend writing any changes down to avoid confusion body begin with color 1 chain 48 slip_stitch into first chain to close circle 48 row 1 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet around slip_stitch into top of first stitch to close round 48 row 2 switch to color 2 slip_stitch between two posts to begin color change chain 3 2dc in the same space you slip stitched into *skip 3 posts 3dc between posts * repeat * 14 times slip_stitch to close round 48 or 16 clusters row 3-8 switch to color 3 for row 3 color 4 for row 4 5 for 5 6 for 6 1 for 7 & 2 for 8 slip_stitch into gap to begin color change chain 3 2dc in same gap 3dc in next gap and each gap across slip_stitch into top of first stitch to close round 48 or 16 clusters tie off any loose ends and set aside for later arms begin each arm using color 1 chain 12 slip_stitch into very first stitch to close 12 row 1 chain 3 2dc in next stitch *double_crochet 2dc* around slip_stitch to close round 18 row 2 switch to color 2 slip_stitch between posts chain 3 2dc in same space *skip 3 posts 3dc between posts* around slip_stitch to close round 18 or 6 clusters row 3-8 switch to color 3 for row 3 color 4 for row 4 5 for 5 6 for 6 1 for 7 2 for 8 slip_stitch in gap chain 3 2dc in same gap 3dc in next
